{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ethnicity can influence a variety of factors related to health care, including access to care, cultural beliefs about illness and death, and preferences for end-of-life care. These factors can all influence where a person with cancer might die. For example, some ethnic groups may prefer to die at home surrounded by family, while others may have better access to hospital care. Therefore, ethnicity can indeed affect where people with cancer die.", "answer_choice": "A"}
